ai-dn20:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Sakyans, near Kapilavatthu in the Great Wood, together with a large Saṅgha of around five hundred mendicants, all of whom were perfected ones.
ai-dn20:1.3_0: And most of the deities from ten solar systems had gathered to see the Buddha and the Saṅgha of mendicants.
ai-dn20:2.1_0: Then four deities of the Pure Abodes, aware of what was happening, thought:
ai-dn20:2.2_0: “The Buddha is staying in the land of the Sakyans, near Kapilavatthu in the Great Wood, together with a large Saṅgha of around five hundred mendicants, all of whom were perfected ones.
ai-dn20:2.3_0: And most of the deities from ten solar systems had gathered to see the Buddha and the Saṅgha of mendicants.
ai-dn20:2.4_0: Well now, we too could approach the Fortunate One,
ai-dn20:2.4_1: and after approaching the Buddha recited this verse in his presence.”
ai-dn20:3.1_0: Then, as easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm, they vanished from the bank of the river Vaggumudā, and reappeared in the presence of the Buddha in the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
ai-dn20:3.1_1: so did the same thing happened amongst the gods.
ai-dn20:3.2_0: They bowed to the Buddha and stood to one side.
ai-dn20:3.3_0: Standing to one side, one deity recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
ai-dn20:3.4_0: “There is a great convention in the wood,
ai-dn20:3.5_0: a host of gods have assembled.
ai-dn20:3.6_0: we have come to this Dhamma convention
ai-dn20:3.8_0: Then another deity recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
ai-dn20:3.10_0: they have straightened out their minds by themselves,
ai-dn20:3.11_0: like a charioteer who has taken the reins,
ai-dn20:3.13_0: Then another deity recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
ai-dn20:3.14_0: “Having cut off the hindrance and obstacle,
ai-dn20:3.15_0: they’re unstirred, with boundary pillar uprooted.
ai-dn20:3.17_0: the young dragons tamed by the seer.”
ai-dn20:3.18_0: Then another deity recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
ai-dn20:3.19_0: “Anyone who has gone to the Buddha for refuge
ai-dn20:3.20_0: won’t go to a plane of loss.
ai-dn20:3.21_0: After giving up this human body,
ai-dn20:3.22_0: they will fill up the ranks of the gods.”
ai-dn20:4.1_0: Then the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
ai-dn20:4.2_0: “Mendicants, most of the deities from ten solar systems have gathered to see the Realized One and the mendicant Saṅgha.
ai-dn20:4.3_0: The Buddhas of the past had, and the Buddhas of the future will have, gatherings of deities that are at most like the gathering for me now.
ai-dn20:4.4_0: Even the Buddhas of the future will have, gatherings of deities that are at most like the gathering for me now.
ai-dn20:4.5_0: I shall declare the names of the heavenly hosts;
ai-dn20:4.6_0: I shall extol the names of the heavenly hosts;
ai-dn20:4.7_0: I shall teach the names of the heavenly hosts.
ai-dn20:4.8_0: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-dn20:5.1_0: “I shall invoke a paean of praise!
ai-dn20:5.9_0: The teacher knew that over five hundred
ai-dn20:5.10_0: were in the wood at Kapilavatthu.
ai-dn20:5.12_0: the disciples who love the teaching:
ai-dn20:5.14_0: mendicants, you should be aware of them.”
ai-dn20:5.15_0: But they’ve plucked out the blessings,
ai-dn20:6.7_0: Some saw them with little water,
ai-dn20:6.12_0: the disciples who love the teaching:
ai-dn20:6.14_0: mendicants, you should be aware of them.
ai-dn20:6.15_0: I shall extol them for you,
ai-dn20:7.1_0: There are seven thousand yakkhas, Earth gods from Kapilavatthu,
ai-dn20:7.6_0: to the meeting of mendicants in the wood.
ai-dn20:7.7_0: From the Himalayas there are six thousand
ai-dn20:7.12_0: to the meeting of mendicants in the wood.
ai-dn20:7.13_0: From Mount Sātā there are three thousand
ai-dn20:7.18_0: to the meeting of mendicants in the wood.
ai-dn20:7.19_0: And thus there are sixteen thousand
ai-dn20:7.24_0: to the meeting of mendicants in the wood.
ai-dn20:8.1_0: From Vessamittā there are five hundred
ai-dn20:8.6_0: to the meeting of mendicants in the wood.
ai-dn20:8.8_0: whose home is on Mount Vepulla.
ai-dn20:8.12_0: also came to the meeting in the wood.
ai-dn20:9.10_0: to the meeting of mendicants in the wood.
ai-dn20:9.20_0: to the meeting of mendicants in the wood.
ai-dn20:9.30_0: to the meeting of mendicants in the wood.
ai-dn20:9.40_0: to the meeting of mendicants in the wood.
ai-dn20:9.48_0: were in the wood at Kapilavatthu.
ai-dn20:10.2_0: came in the shade of the wounds and creepers.
ai-dn20:10.10_0: and the kings Nala and Janesabha,
ai-dn20:10.16_0: to the meeting of mendicants in the wood.
ai-dn20:11.8_0: also came to the meeting in the wood.
ai-dn20:11.9_0: Those who carry away the nāga kings by force
ai-dn20:11.10_0: divine, twice-born birds with piercing vision—
ai-dn20:11.11_0: swoop down to the wood from the sky;
ai-dn20:11.13_0: But at that time the nāga kings were without fear,
ai-dn20:11.14_0: The Buddha Khema, Khemā, and Awakened One,
ai-dn20:11.15_0: Calling on (one another) with gentle words,
ai-dn20:11.16_0: the dragons and phoenixes took the Buddha as their refuge.
ai-dn20:12.3_0: they are brothers of Vāsava, having psychic power, resplendent,
ai-dn20:12.9_0: and a hundred of Bali’s sons,
ai-dn20:12.11_0: Having given up army, army of Strength,
ai-dn20:12.12_0: and went up to the auspicious Rāhu, saying:
ai-dn20:12.14_0: for the meeting of mendicants in the wood.’
ai-dn20:13.1_0: The gods of Water and Earth,
ai-dn20:13.2_0: and Fire and Wind came there.
ai-dn20:13.5_0: A host of the gods of Love
ai-dn20:13.12_0: to the meeting of mendicants in the wood.
ai-dn20:14.3_0: The gods who depend on the Moon came, with the Moon in front of them.
ai-dn20:14.5_0: The gods living on the sun came,
ai-dn20:14.8_0: came the silly gods of clouds.
ai-dn20:14.10_0: known as Vāsava, the first of the Vasus.
ai-dn20:14.16_0: to the meeting of mendicants in the wood.
ai-dn20:15.3_0: and the Ariṭṭhakas and Rojas too,
ai-dn20:15.4_0: and the gods hued blue as flax.
ai-dn20:15.7_0: the Sūleyyas and Ruciras all came,
ai-dn20:15.14_0: to the meeting of mendicants in the wood.
ai-dn20:16.3_0: and the gods depraved by play,
ai-dn20:16.14_0: to the meeting of mendicants in the wood.
ai-dn20:17.3_0: And the Odātagayhas came as chiefs
ai-dn20:17.8_0: he who rains on all quarters.
ai-dn20:17.14_0: to the meeting of mendicants in the wood.
ai-dn20:18.4_0: and the defilements that bring absorption.
ai-dn20:18.5_0: The Gods Who Love to Create came too,
ai-dn20:18.6_0: Then came the signs of others
ai-dn20:18.12_0: to the meeting of mendicants in the wood.
ai-dn20:19.3_0: They came in order of their names,
ai-dn20:19.5_0: ‘We shall see those rid of rebirth, kind,
ai-dn20:19.7_0: and the dragon who brought them across,
ai-dn20:19.8_0: who like the Moon has overcome darkness.’
ai-dn20:20.2_0: with sons of those powerful ones.
ai-dn20:20.4_0: also came to the meeting in the wood.
ai-dn20:20.10_0: each one of them wielding power,
ai-dn20:20.11_0: and in the middle of them came
ai-dn20:21.1_0: When they had all come forth—
ai-dn20:21.2_0: the gods with their Lord, and the Brahmās—
ai-dn20:21.4_0: see the stupidity of the Dark Lord!
ai-dn20:21.9_0: And so there the great general
ai-dn20:21.11_0: He struck the ground with his fist
ai-dn20:21.13_0: like a storm cloud shedding rain,
ai-dn20:22.4_0: the disciples who love the teaching:
ai-dn20:22.6_0: mendicants, you should be aware of them.”
ai-dn20:22.7_0: But they’ve plucked out the blessings,
ai-dn20:22.9_0: The army fled from those free of passion,
ai-dn20:22.10_0: and not a single hair was stirred!
ai-dn20:22.13_0: They rejoice with all the spirits,
ai-dn20:22.15_0: The seventh section on the Great Congregation is finished.
